turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sharp-Mickle House.
turn.2: Sharp-Mickle House The Sharp-Mickle House is a Gothic Revival style dwelling located in Mauricetown, New Jersey, constructed around 1860 by landowner and farmer Seth Sharp.
turn.4: The building today resembles its appearance after its 1879 remodel by Samuel Mickle .
turn.5: Is the house open to the public?
turn.6: This building is a private residence and not open to the public.
turn.7: What else can you tell me about the house?
turn.8: The Sharp-Mickle House is four bay, three-story frame dwelling located along the scenic Maurice River.
turn.9: Is the house in any other historic places?
turn.10: The building contains many characteristics of its Gothic Revival style such as a cross-gable, lancet windows, a bay window, and ornate porches featuring scroll-sawn tracery and brackets.
turn.11: What other features does the house have?
turn.12: The relatively uniform exterior masks the buildings complex history of alterations and adaptations.
